diagrams.descriptionHtml: Use of NFPA 13R sprinklers are limited to R occupancies and may severely limit the allowed height and/or number of stories, especially if also required to be in compliance with the Life Safety Code (NFPA 101) or the 2021 based building codes, even if used in a podium condition.

diagrams.title: Podiums: Horizontal Bldg. Separation (510.2)
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
Section 510.2 provides a special condition which would allow a lesser type of construction above a Type I "podium". Sometimes there are multiple buildings over a common podium, which can be common in Group R-2 buildings.

Items that are new for 2018 codes include the allowance for vertical offsets in the horizontal assembly and a requirement for the horizontal assembly to also be Type IA construction.

diagrams.title: Fire Walls: Vertical Continuity - Exception 5
diagrams.descriptionHtml: In certain cases a fire wall is not required to start at the foundation or to terminate 30" above an adjacent roof. In the event the building is located above a 3 hr rated horizontal separation required for podium buildings by Section 510.2, the fire wall may start at the top of the rated podium assembly.

diagrams.title: Single Bldgs. Divided by Fire Walls
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
In new construction, for the purposes of determining area limitations, height limitations and type of construction, each portion of a building separated by one or more fire walls complying with Section 706 shall be considered to be a separate building.

Where adopted, the Existing Building Code (IEBC) allows under very certain conditions the use of a fire barrier in lieu of a fire wall when there is a change of occupancy for lower hazard uses. Frequently, it would be very difficult to provide a fully code compliant fire wall in many of these situations.

diagrams.title: Vertical Offsets in Podium Horizontal Assemblies
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Where a vertical offset is part of a horizontal assembly utilized to establish separate buildings the offset is required to be constructed as a 3 hour minimum fire-resistance rated fire barrier per Section 707. Structural elements that support the fire-barrier need protection equal to or greater than the fire-resistance rating of the fire barrier being supported.

diagrams.title: Vertical Offsets in Podium Horizontal Assemblies - Cross Section
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Where a vertical offset is part of a horizontal assembly utilized to establish separate buildings the offset is required to be constructed as a 3 hour minimum fire-resistance rated fire barrier per Section 707. Structural elements that support the fire-barrier need protection equal to or greater than the fire-resistance rating of the fire barrier being supported.

diagrams.title: Multiple Buildings Above a Horizontal Assembly
diagrams.descriptionHtml: The buildings above a Group S-2 parking garage or other building may be regarded as separate and distinct buildings from each other when separated from the building below by a horizontal assembly in accordance with the special provisions of Sections 510.2, 510.3 or 510.8.

children.body:
A Group S-2 enclosed parking garage with not more than one story above grade plane and located below a Group S-2 open parking garage shall be classified as a separate and distinct building for the purpose of determining the type of construction where the following conditions are met:
  1. The allowable area of the building shall be such that the sum of the ratios of the actual area divided by the allowable area for each separate occupancy shall not exceed 1.
  2. The Group S-2 enclosed parking garage is of Type I or II construction and is at least equal to the fire-resistance requirements of the Group S-2 open parking garage.
  3. The height and the number of tiers of the Group S-2 open parking garage shall be limited as specified in Table 406.5.4.
  4. The floor assembly separating the Group S-2 enclosed parking garage and Group S-2 open parking garage shall be protected as required for the floor assembly of the Group S-2 enclosed parking garage. Openings between the Group S-2 enclosed parking garage and Group S-2 open parking garage, except exit openings, shall not be required to be protected.
  5. The Group S-2 enclosed parking garage is used exclusively for the parking or storage of private motor vehicles, but shall be permitted to contain an office, waiting room and toilet room having a total area of not more than 1,000 square feet (93 m2) and mechanical equipment rooms associated with the operation of the building.

diagrams.title: Open Parking Garage
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Open Parking Garage: a structure or portion of a structure with openings on two or more exterior walls that is used for the parking or storage of private motor vehicles.

diagrams.title: Group S-2 Enclosed Parking Garage With Group S-2 Open Parking Garage Above
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
A Group S-2 enclosed parking garage with no more than one story above grade plane, located beneath a Group S-2 open parking garage, is considered a separate building for construction type purposes if the following conditions are met:
  • The sum of area actual area to allowable area ratios of both occupancies must not exceed 1;
  • The enclosed garage is of type I or II construction and has equal or greater fire resistance than required for the open parking garage;
  • The open garage complies with height and tier limits in Table 406.5.4;
  • The floor assembly separating the two types of garages must meet the enclosed garage's fire protection requirements;
  • Openings other than exit openings between the two garage types are not required to be protected;
  • And the enclosed garage must be used solely for private vehicle parking or storage.
An accessory use area up to 1000 sf that may contain an office, waiting room, and toilet room is allowed in the enclosed garage. The enclosed garage may also contain a mechanical room that serves the building.

diagrams.title: Enclosed Parking Garage Ventilation - Ducted System
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Enclosed parking garages are required to have continuously running ventilation systems unless provided with approved sensor control system. Refer to the applicable mechanical code for automatic control requirements as the UMC and IMC automatic system control requirements are different.

diagrams.title: Enclosed Parking Garage Ventilation - Ductless Jet-Induction System
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Enclosed parking garages are required to have continuously running ventilation systems unless provided with approved sensor control system. Refer to the applicable mechanical code for automatic control requirements as the UMC and IMC automatic system control requirements are different.

diagrams.title: Multiple Buildings Above a Horizontal Assembly
diagrams.descriptionHtml: The buildings above a Group S-2 parking garage or other building may be regarded as separate and distinct buildings from each other when separated from the building below by a horizontal assembly in accordance with the special provisions of Sections 510.2, 510.3 or 510.8.

children.displayTitle: 510.3 Group S-2 Enclosed Parking Garage With Group S-2 Open Parking Garage Above
children.titleText: Group S-2 Enclosed Parking Garage With Group S-2 Open Parking Garage Above

children.body: Where a maximum one story above grade plane Group S-2 parking garage, enclosed or open, or combination thereof, of Type I construction or open of Type IV construction, with grade entrance, is provided under a building of Group R, the number of stories to be used in determining the minimum type of construction shall be measured from the floor above such a parking area. The floor assembly between the parking garage and the Group R above shall comply with the type of construction required for the parking garage and shall also provide a fire-resistance rating not less than the mixed occupancy separation required in Section 508.4.

diagrams.title: Attic Fire Protection - Condition 3 & 4 (NFPA 13R)
diagrams.descriptionHtml: When using NFPA 13R sprinklers, attic protection is required for specific podium construction and Group R-4, Condition 2 situations.

diagrams.title: NFPA 13R System Scoping (2021)
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Use of NFPA 13R sprinklers are limited to R occupancies and may severely limit the allowed height and/or number of stories, especially if also required to be in compliance with the Life Safety Code (NFPA 101) or the 2021 based building codes, even if used in a podium condition.

diagrams.title: Podiums: Parking Beneath Group R
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
Section 510.4 allows for the increase of one story above a Type I closed/open garage or Type IV open garage with a horizontal assembly with a fire resistive rating equal to that of 508.4 or the required type of construction, whichever is greater. Section 406.5.3 allows open parking garages complying with 510.4 to be mixed use occupancies. Depending on the other occupancy groups below the R occupancy it is possible areas could require a greater fire-resistance rating than is required for the type of construction.

Some literature suggests that a lesser rating can be applied to the floor of type IV construction. However, the wording of the code section does not seem to provide that option. Heavy timber construction for floors is based on a prescriptive size of wood members. Mass timber construction requires a minimum floor rating of 2 hours, and only footnote a of Table 601 allows for reduction of ratings of a floor rating. It does not appear the code allows for reduction of the floor rating to 1 hour, as some suggest.

The user should also be aware that starting with the 2021 year edition, sections of 903.3.1.2 more severely restricts the use of NFPA 13R systems for this condition to the grade plane, instead of the horizontal assembly above the garage.

children.body: For buildings of Type IIIA construction in Groups R-1 and R-2, the maximum allowable height in Table 504.3 shall be increased by 10 feet (3048 mm) and the maximum allowable number of stories in Table 504.4 shall be increased by one where the first-floor assembly above the basement has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 3 hours and the floor area is subdivided by 2-hour fire-resistance-rated fire walls into areas of not more than 3,000 square feet (279 m2).

diagrams.title: Podiums: Type IIIA Height Increase (2021)
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Although the provisions of Section 510.5 do not address sprinkler system use, the new (2021) limitations for use of NFPA 13R systems to 4 stories and 30 feet would preclude the use of NFPA 13R for a full height Type III-A building. In addition, non-sprinklered new construction for Group R occupancy is not permitted. Therefore, an NFPA 13 system would be required for this condition.

diagrams.title: Fire Walls and Party Walls
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
Fire Wall: A fire-resistance-rated wall having protected openings, which restricts the spread of fire and extends continuously from the foundation to or through the roof, with sufficient structural stability under fire conditions to allow collapse of construction on either side without collapse of the wall.

Use of fire walls separating occupancies where fire separations using fire barriers are required are required to conform to the most restrictive items between the two. Be sure and verify requirements for occupancy separation, incidental use requirements and those related to hazardous materials, among others are met.

diagrams.title: Type IIIA Construction
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Type III construction is that type of construction in which the exterior walls are of noncombustible materials and the interior building elements are of any material permitted by this code. Fire-retardant-treated wood framing and sheathing complying with Section 2303.2 shall be permitted within exterior wall assemblies of a 2-hour rating or less.

children.displayTitle: 510.5 Group R-1 and R-2 Buildings of Type IIIA Construction
children.titleText: Group R-1 and R-2 Buildings of Type IIIA Construction

children.body: The height limitation for buildings of Type IIA construction in Groups R-1 and R-2 shall be increased to nine stories and 100 feet (30 480 mm) where the building is separated by not less than 50 feet (15 240 mm) from any other building on the lot and from lot lines, the exits are segregated in an area enclosed by a 2-hour fire-resistance-rated fire wall and the first floor assembly has a fire-resistance rating of not less than 11/2 hours.

diagrams.title: Group R-1 & R-2 Bldgs Type IIA - Height Increase Pt 1
diagrams.descriptionHtml: The code provides for special provisions for additional height and number of stories when additional fire protection measures as prescribed by the code are provided. For group R-1 and R-2 buildings of type IIA construction the height limitations may be increased to 9 stories and 100 feet when the following additional fire protection measures are part of the design. The fire separation distance to all lot lines or to any other building on the lot must be not less than 50". The exits from each floor must also be segregated from each other in an area enclosed by a 2 hour fire-resistance rated fire wall. The first floor assembly must have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1-1/2 hours. Per 704.1 any structure supporting the first floor assembly would likewise also need to have the same 1-1/2 hour fire protection rating.

diagrams.title: Group R-1 & R-2 Bldgs Type IIA - Height Increase Pt 2
diagrams.descriptionHtml: The code provides for special provisions for additional height and number of stories when additional fire protection measures as prescribed by the code are provided. For group R-1 and R-2 buildings of type IIA construction the height limitations may be increased to 9 stories and 100 feet when the following additional fire protection measures are part of the design. The fire separation distance to all lot lines or to any other building on the lot must be not less than 50". The exits from each floor must also be segregated from each other in an area enclosed by a 2 hour fire-resistance rated fire wall. The first floor assembly must have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1-1/2 hours.

diagrams.title: Fire Walls and Party Walls
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
Fire Wall: A fire-resistance-rated wall having protected openings, which restricts the spread of fire and extends continuously from the foundation to or through the roof, with sufficient structural stability under fire conditions to allow collapse of construction on either side without collapse of the wall.

Use of fire walls separating occupancies where fire separations using fire barriers are required are required to conform to the most restrictive items between the two. Be sure and verify requirements for occupancy separation, incidental use requirements and those related to hazardous materials, among others are met.

diagrams.title: Type IIA Construction
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
Type IIA ("Two-A") construction is classified as non-combustible construction. The "A" portion of the construction type generally denotes that primary elements of the building are required to be fire-rated construction.

Use of any combustible materials in Type I or II construction is regulated by Section 603, and includes more than just wood materials, such as combustible data cabling, which could be installed after occupancy in a non-compliant manner.

children.displayTitle: 510.6 Group R-1 and R-2 Buildings of Type IIA Construction
children.titleText: Group R-1 and R-2 Buildings of Type IIA Construction

children.body: Open parking garages constructed under Groups A, I, B, M and R shall not exceed the height and area limitations permitted under Section 406.5. The height and area of the portion of the building above the open parking garage shall not exceed the limitations in Section 503 for the upper occupancy. The height, in both feet and stories, of the portion of the building above the open parking garage shall be measured from grade plane and shall include both the open parking garage and the portion of the building above the parking garage.

diagrams.title: Open Parking Garage
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Open Parking Garage: a structure or portion of a structure with openings on two or more exterior walls that is used for the parking or storage of private motor vehicles.

diagrams.title: Open Parking Garage Beneath Groups A, I, B, M and R
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Where a group A, I, B, M or R building is above an Open Parking Garage the allowable height and area for the building above and the garage are determined by different sections of the code. The height and area of the garage is dictated by section 406.5. The height and area of the building above is determined by section 503, includes the height and stories of the garage and is measured from grade plane. The two buildings need to be separated by fire barriers or horizontal assemblies with fire resistance ratings per Table 508.4 for the two uses. 2 hour fire-resistance rated fire barriers or horizontal assemblies are required to separate the means of egress for the upper building from the garage.

children.displayTitle: 510.7 Open Parking Garage Beneath Groups A, I, B, M and R
children.titleText: Open Parking Garage Beneath Groups A, I, B, M and R

children.body: Fire barriers constructed in accordance with Section 707 or horizontal assemblies constructed in accordance with Section 711 between the parking occupancy and the upper occupancy shall correspond to the required fire-resistance rating prescribed in Table 508.4 for the uses involved. The type of construction shall apply to each occupancy individually, except that structural members, including main bracing within the open parking structure, which is necessary to support the upper occupancy, shall be protected with the more restrictive fire-resistance-rated assemblies of the groups involved as shown in Table 601. Means of egress for the upper occupancy shall conform to Chapter 10 and shall be separated from the parking occupancy by fire barriers having not less than a 2-hour fire-resistance rating as required by Section 707 with self-closing doors complying with Section 716 or horizontal assemblies having not less than a 2-hour fire-resistance rating as required by Section 711, with self-closing doors complying with Section 716. Means of egress from the open parking garage shall comply with Section 406.5.

Group B or M occupancies located below a Group S-2 open parking garage of a lesser type of construction shall be considered as a separate and distinct building from the Group S-2 open parking garage for the purpose of determining the type of construction where the following conditions are met:
  1. The buildings are separated with a horizontal assembly having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 hours.
  2. The occupancies in the building below the horizontal assembly are limited to Groups B and M.
  3. The occupancy above the horizontal assembly is limited to a Group S-2 open parking garage.
  4. The building below the horizontal assembly is of Type IA construction.
    Exception: The building below the horizontal assembly shall be permitted to be of Type IB or II construction, but not less than the type of construction required for the Group S-2 open parking garage above, where the building below is not greater than one story in height above grade plane.
  5. The height and area of the building below the horizontal assembly does not exceed the limits set forth in Section 503.
  6. The height and area of the Group S-2 open parking garage does not exceed the limits set forth in Section 406.5. The height, in both feet and stories, of the Group S-2 open parking garage shall be measured from grade plane and shall include the building below the horizontal assembly.
  7. Exits serving the Group S-2 open parking garage shall discharge at grade with direct and unobstructed access to a street or public way and are separated from the building below the horizontal assembly by 2-hour fire barriers constructed in accordance with Section 707 or 2-hour horizontal assemblies constructed in accordance with Section 711, or both.

diagrams.title: Open Parking Garage
diagrams.descriptionHtml: Open Parking Garage: a structure or portion of a structure with openings on two or more exterior walls that is used for the parking or storage of private motor vehicles.

diagrams.title: Group B or M Bldgs w/ Group S-2 Open Parking Garage Above
diagrams.descriptionHtml:
The code provides a special provision to allow for vehicle parking to be placed above a place of business or retail. For the purpose of determining the type of construction, an S-2 open parking structure may be considered separately from a group B or M occupancy building below when all of the following conditions are met:
  1. A horizontal assembly of not less than 2 hours fire-resistance separates the two buildings
  2. The occupancy of the building below is limited to group B and M
  3. The occupancy of the building above is limited to a Group S-2 open parking garage
  4. The building below the horizontal assembly is of type IA construction. Exception: Where the building below is limited to 1 story in height the construction type for the lower building may be type IB or II but not less than the construction type required by the S-2 open parking garage above.
  5. The lower building complies with the height and area limits set forth in Section 503 (table 504).
  6. The upper building complies with the height and area limits set forth in Section 406.5. The height, in both feet and stories, shall be measured from grade plane and include the building below.
  7. Exits serving the garage discharge at grade with direct access to a street or public way and are separated from the building below by 2-hour fire barriers, 2-hour horizontal assemblies or both.

diagrams.title: Multiple Buildings Above a Horizontal Assembly
diagrams.descriptionHtml: The buildings above a Group S-2 parking garage or other building may be regarded as separate and distinct buildings from each other when separated from the building below by a horizontal assembly in accordance with the special provisions of Sections 510.2, 510.3 or 510.8.

children.displayTitle: 510.8 Group B or M Buildings With Group S-2 Open Parking Garage Above
children.titleText: Group B or M Buildings With Group S-2 Open Parking Garage Above

children.body: Where two or more buildings are provided above the horizontal assembly separating a Group S-2 parking garage or building below from the buildings above in accordance with the special provisions in Section 510.2, 510.3 or 510.8, the buildings above the horizontal assembly shall be regarded as separate and distinct buildings from each other and shall comply with all other provisions of this code as applicable to each separate and distinct building.

diagrams.title: Multiple Buildings Above a Horizontal Assembly
diagrams.descriptionHtml: The buildings above a Group S-2 parking garage or other building may be regarded as separate and distinct buildings from each other when separated from the building below by a horizontal assembly in accordance with the special provisions of Sections 510.2, 510.3 or 510.8.
